div: This tool allows you to obtain information about aged nuclides, such as activities or gamma/alpha/beta production rates, or the decay chain as well as further information about each of the descendant nuclides. There are two main portions of this tool used to extract information: the Activity Chart tab and Decay Chain tabs; usage information and hints are offered in the similarly named subsections.

For both of these tools the initially selected nuclide information will be displayed for whatever nuclide the Reference Photopeaks tool is currently displaying, or if it is not displaying any reference gamma lines for nuclides, a default nuclide.
The Activity Chart display can display the activity, or emission rate of gamma, beta, or alpha particles as a function of time for the chosen parent and descendant nuclides.
Clicking on the chart will bring up a text listing of nuclide activities and decay particle types, their energies and intensities, as well as some additional information, all for the time clicked.

If the check-boxes in the legend are un-checked, then the nuclide listed next to it will not be displayed on the decay chart; this is useful when the activities of a number of descendant products overlap (hence hiding each other) and you wish to verify the location of the decay curve.
Adjusting the Time Span changes the x-axis range displayed, and can be useful for zooming in on the initial decay period.

div.div: Note: The "nuc. search" field will update the element and isotope selection fields with suggestions as you type. No suggestions will be offered before you enter text, but the element and isotope fields will still be populated if you wish to select your nuclide that way. If you wish to get quantitative information on the activity as a function of time, you can select the initial activity of the nuclide. If you wish to have a minimum age for the decay chart to start at, you can also fill in a minimum age here.

Example screen shot of the Nuclide Decay Information tool showing the Decay Chain tab.
You can click on a nuclide to obtain further information about its half life, parents, and decays. This will also create and area in the upper-right of the chart with text similar to "Show Decays Through <<nuclide>>" that if clicked on will bring up a chart of all nuclides that decay through the selected nuclide.
Double-click on a nuclide will bring up information about the decay products (gamma/beta/alpha) from that nuclide.
If you have selected multiple nuclides in the upper source area, the decay chain shown can be changed by clicking on a different parent nuclide in the upper source area.
